intro: Lycianthes viridis, commonly known as the green physalis, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its clusters of bright green, inflated calyces that enclose small, yellow-orange berries. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, sunny conditions and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. The berries are edible when ripe and are sometimes used in culinary applications.
